fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43001].
  {panel}

Hello,

i'd find it quite useful, if there would be the possibility to link JIRA-Boards with Confluence-Pages so you can quickly switch between them.

It's also helpful for all users, because they wouldn't have to search for the Confluence Page, which belongs to the board. They would simply click on the link and get there.

This could be implemented in the configuration of the boards.

For a prototype please have a look at the attachment.
fields.summary: Feature Request: Links on Jira-Boards to Confluence-Pages
Suggestion to change hyperlink behaviour in JIRA

User Management

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42979].
  {panel}

In JIRA 6.4.x, another 2 advanced options are made available in Advanced Settings:
!advanced_config.png!

Among these, *jira.bulk.create.max.issues.per.import* is quite important in which it allows admin to specify how many issues can be bulk created at a time or if this feature should be disabled. There're discussions about this at:
* ["Import Issues" function should have additional permission requirements|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-40974]
* [Customer request for more control on user CSV import access|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/JIM-1414]

*Suggestion*: update [Configuring Advanced Settings|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Advanced+Settings] to reflect this

*Note*: [Creating issues using the CSV importer|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Creating+issues+using+the+CSV+importer] may also need to be updated to mention this advanced setting
fields.summary: Update documentation for Configuring Advanced Settings

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42970].
  {panel}

As an admin, I am unable to bulk move all/any time tracking/work logged fields from user A to user B. 

As per:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Modifying+Multiple+('Bulk')+Issues , Time Tracking fields are not available for bulk editing. 

Suggestion: Add secondary account related database fields for time tracking entries so that if user A leaves the company, user B can inherit pre-existing data so that reporting can be spread across both users.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42955].
  {panel}

When sending email from System/Send Email, would be good to have default option for email format TEXT, not HTML. 

Each time JIRA administrators broadcasting emails to JIRA users forget selecting the format - HTML is default, so email comes as brick of text, not readable at all.

Default HTML would make sense if "Body" have rich-text-editing controls.
Without them, editing HTML tags is not a good idea.
fields.summary: Default for message type when sending email should be TEXT not HTML.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42949].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When warning users about restricted characters in an attachment filename, JIRA refers to characters that aren't actually in the name.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
(example)
# Create an issue.
# Attempt to attach a file with name "test/test.txt"

h3. Expected Results
An error message warning about {{/}} being a restricted character is displayed.

h3. Actual Results
In the error message, the restricted character is replaced with a colon: 
!Screen Shot 2015-04-20 at 2.42.54 pm.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround
Regardless of the content of the error message, remove all restricted characters (as listed in the documentation - [Attaching a File|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Attaching+a+File]): {{'\', '/','\"', '%', ':', '$', '?', '*'}} from the filename.
fields.summary: "Invalid filename" Warning for Attachments Refers to Characters That Are Not in the Filename

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42935].
  {panel}

In JIRA 6.3 Supported Platforms documentation: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA063/Supported+Platforms has stated this:

bq. This page lists the supported platforms for JIRA 6.3 only. If a particular platform or a particular platform's version is not noted on this page, then we do not support it for JIRA 6.3.

When we run a JIRA 6.3 standalone version (.zip or installer), it's shows Apache Tomcat version {{7.0.47}} instead of {{7.0.55}} (according to the document). 

This information is very confusing and users are not sure which Apache Tomcat version is bundled with JIRA 6.3.
fields.summary: Need update on JIRA 6.3 Supported Platforms documentation
ReplicatedIndexOperation consumes massive space in JIRA data export

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42932].
  {panel}

Hi team, 

By default a backup service will automatically be configured to run every 12 hours. This will create problems for large installations.

I think we should
#  modify page https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Automating+JIRA+Backups and 
add instruction how this XML backup can be disabled: 
eg: delete *Backup Service*  at _Administration_ > _System_ > _Advanced_ > _Services_
#  modify pages: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Backing+Up+Data, https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Automating+JIRA+Backups
and add to warning section '_For production use, it is strongly recommended_' additional text that automatic backup should be disabled in that case.

Thanks in advance.
fields.summary: Documentation request: Add to Automating+JIRA+Backups how to disable backup for production

  {panel}

I frequently need the ability to ask a member of my team a question and have the response documented in the Jira thread.consider the following scenario:
  * Bob assigns me Jira issue saying "incorrect number of 'blats' in database".
  * I want to ask Susan, "Please run the following blats query on database and post the result."

I do not want to assign the Jira issue to Susan as iit is my responsibility, and I'm actively working on it as there's other things to research.

Perhaps these questions could be treated as light-weight or non-numbered subtasks. 

Extra bonus would be the ability for the person answering the question to log the amount of time they spent on the question along with the answer.
fields.summary: Ability to ask Questions from within issue -- Light Subtasks?

  {panel}

When releasing a version from the *Project Overview > Releases*, you have the option to set the Release Date. When your language is set to Russian, German, French or Japanese, the date picker for the Release Date is corrupted, as per this screenshot: 
[^DatePickerCorrupt.png]
As per above, all the values are undefined. 

This problem does *not* happen if you are releasing the version when your language is set to English (US or UK) or Spanish. 

This is the only date picker that is affected, the fields in other screens work fine in all languages (e.g. editing issue date fields isn't affected)

h6.Workarounds
- Set language to English in your *User profile* before releasing the version.
- Set the version's release date before clicking the *Release* button. This can be done *Project Administration > Versions* view page: [^ManageVersions.png].
- Release versions from the *Project Administration > Versions* view.
fields.summary: Cannot set version release date due to corrupted date picker when language is set to Russian

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42915].
  {panel}

I have a security scheme that has "Internal" and "External" levels. I have set one of these to the default. The problem is, the "None" option is still available to the users.

JIRA is able to recognize which Security Levels are available to users, including the "None" option. The problem is that the "None" option will be selected automatically for a user if the default Security Level is not available for them. From what I've read in the documentation, the "None" security level means that everyone can access the issue.

The Screens component of JIRA is intelligent enough to not show the "Security Level" option if there is no Issue Security Scheme set for the project. Unfortunately, the Workflows component is not. If you set "Security Level" as required in a workflow, it will not be disabled for a project that doesn't have a Security Scheme set, thus requiring a copy with a very minor change.

This combination of "features" results in reduced re-usability of screens and workflows and potentially unsafe default options if "None" is allowed to be present with no way to remove it or at least default to a more restrictive option.

One proposed fix would be to allow a way to remove the "None" option on fields without requiring us to set it to "Required" in a workflow.

Another option would be to disregard Security Level as a required field in Workflow Validators when the current project does not have a Issue Security Scheme configured.

Another partial fix could also be to default to any option other than "None" if the default is not available to the user.
fields.summary: Required Field does not work well with "None" option in a Security Scheme

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42892].
  {panel}

Not all Custom Fields are available for Issue Collectors. There is some logic to certain field types, such as:
{code}
Group Picker (multiple groups)
Group Picker (single group)
User Picker (single user)
User Picker (multiple user)
Project Picker (single project)
{code}
These fields contain information that an unauthenticated user might not be able to see. Other type fields are not available to Issue Collectors:
{code}
Checkboxes
Date Picker
Hidden Job Switch
Job Checkbox
Labels
Select List (single choice)
{code}
However, whenever an Administrator sets up a custom Issue Collector, they choose what fields are available to the Issue Collector. Additionally, sometimes Issue Collectors are being used by authenticated users, as occasionally Issue Collectors are set up in the Announcement Banner for use within the JIRA environment. As JIRA Administrators, they should have carte blanche to decide what fields are in their Issue Collector, and what fields are not, and in turn have all fields available for addition to this tool.
fields.summary: Make all available Custom Fields for an Issue Type available for the Issue Collector

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42880].
  {panel}

It is not possible from a JIRA issue to create a link to a Confluence page if the page contains the ":" char in its title.
When trying to create the link, JIRA displays the warning message "Unable to create a link to Confluence XXX as the application does not have any authentication configured.", which is absolutely wrong.

Steps to reproduce:
- create an issue in JIRA
- create a page in Confluence with title (for example) "TEST:PAGE"
- try to create a link from the issue issue to the confluence page using the url of the page 
- error is displayed and no link created

Removing the ":" from the title makes the link creation possible.

As this case may happen quite often, this is quite a burden, also because the displayed error has nothing to do with the problem...
fields.summary: Cannot link a jira issue to a confluence page when the page title contains ":"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42878].
  {panel}

When integrating JIRA with subversion or git repositories, currently it is only possible to link to JIRA issues by mentioning the JIRA issue key in commit messages/change sets. There are advantages in making this more configurable, such that one could specify some other property e.g. a custom field that could be used for the link other than issue key if necessary.

The use case for this is usually with users migrating from other issue trackers with pre-existing subversion integration. We may be seeing more requests for this e.g.:
* https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/282164/how-to-index-repository-referecing-ids-from-migrated-bugzilla-issues
* https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/174771/how-to-receive-subversion-commits-of-an-imported-project-using-the-external-issue-id

This applies to different methods of integration including JIRA Subversion plugin, Fisheye plugin, DVCS connector etc.
fields.summary: Make links/mappings to repository changeset configurable

We have noticed that at the end of JIRA Express installation there is an screen telling the user he should use his login and password from Atlassian to use JIRA, but this screen does not enforce this information. Besides that it provides a button from which the user can go to JIRA without the need of login. The consequence is after some time, maybe days, the user loses his JIRA section and needs to login again. At this time he does not know the login and password.

We think this could be solved changing the last screen of the setup for me installation in some way that enforces the important information about the login or/and obligating the user to login at first time he goes to JIRA after installed. 

The screenshoots from the setup for me selection and the last installation screen are attached.

Thanks,
Daniel P Santos

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, JIRA allows Administrators to choose if Gravatar is enabled, which means that an user can either use gravatar or a custom picture in JIRA. As a JIRA Administrator, I would like to force users to only use their gravatar pictures.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the option to use *only* gravatar, along with the existing options to use only JIRA's or both gravatar and JIRA's.
fields.summary: As a JIRA Administrator I would like to choose whether users should use Gravatar, JIRA avatars or both.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42853].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Prior to JIRA 6.3, enabling users to use Gravatars in their user profile instead of JIRA-specific avatars caused users not to be able to use JIRA-specific avatars (and vice versa). However, from 6.3 onwards as part of JRA-33596 it is now able to use both together.

However, according to our [Configuring JIRA Options|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+JIRA+Options] documentation:
bq. Enables users to use Gravatars in their user profile instead of JIRA-specific avatars. Users will not be able to use JIRA-specific avatars if Gravatars are enabled, and vice versa. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Edit the above to match what is displayed in JIRA - something like:
bq. Allows loading external avatars from a Gravatar server
fields.summary: Update Configuring JIRA Options documentation regarding Gravatars

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42821].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When creating an issue, if we switch the fields being shown via the 'Configure Fields' button (for example switching from 'All' to 'Custom' and vice-versa), the value of custom fields would be cleared out

h3. Environment
* Tested in JIRA 6.3.12

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field (for the sake of testing, we will use a multi-line text field)
# Make sure that it is in the screen when creating an issue, and insert a value into the field (don't create the issue yet though)
# Use the 'Configure Fields' button to switch over from 'All' to 'Custom' (ensure that the field is showing in 'Custom' as well)

h3. Expected Results

The value of the field should still be present even though the tab is switched.

h3. Actual Results
The values of the field does not appear

!configurefield1.png|thumbnail! 

!configurefield2.png|thumbnail,!

h3. Notes
* This does not occur when editing an already created issue
* Have also tested this in Select List custom field, same problem occurs

h3.Solution / Workaround

This seems to have been fixed in JIRA 6.4, as it no longer occurs in that version
fields.summary: Switching the fields tab via the 'Configure Fields' button clears out custom field values

Thanks.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42812].
  {panel}

When working with large projects and hundreds to thousands of users it's not uncommon for users to see errors in issues that moderators miss. Currently the best they can do to help is to comment on an issue. To better facilitate this JIRA should add a moderation queue.

Users would be given the full moderator toolkit and the ability to make any change they want. The only catch is their requests would be added to a moderation queue. So a user could decide to change the title, link an issue to a duplicate, or close an issue and these would show up as chronological requests in the moderation queue.

A moderator would then be able to view pending requests and approve or deny them and visually see what's being change from the old value to the new value. This would allow many rapid changes to be made with the help of a large community. Moderators could also remove all the requests from a specific user from the queue.

Another useful feature would be to connect the number of approved moderations to specific users. This might help communities in picking out future moderators for community driven issue trackers and to reward users that are helping.
fields.summary: Add a moderation queue that regular users can add requests to and that moderators can approve or deny
Filter subscriptions: config uses server time

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42806].

When using the Wiki Style Rendering on fields (such as the Description field), navigation with keyboard shortcuts do not function as they would in plain-text fields (ex: Summary).

One example found:

Would like to utilize navigation with keyboard shortcuts in addition to the Wiki Style Rendering on fields.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42802].
  {panel}

h4. Summary
When an existing JIRA user send an email to create issue, even though the *Default Reporter* has been set, the issue will not be created.

h4. Environment
JIRA 6.3.15
Gmail email account

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Create new JIRA Mail Handler to Project A, set Default reporter to *admin*
# Create new Permission Scheme, and limit *Create Issue* and *Add Comments* to jira-administrators group
# Create *UserA* as a normal user
# Have *UserA* send an email to create issue in JIRA

h4. Expected Results
Issue will be created and *admin* will be the reporter

h4. Actual Results
Email will be ignored and issue is not created in JIRA
!ignoredmail.png|thumbnail!

h4. Notes
[~libor.tvrdik1] came up with this patch: [^jira-mail-plugin.patch]. Can we look into this [~ohernandez@atlassian.com]?
fields.summary: Unable to create issue from email when the Reporter does not have permission to create an issue

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42801].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 6 September 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Attaching issues on the workflow transition screen is not now supported, as of JIRA 7.2.1.
 The feature request to support the feature is tracked under JRA-42900.

Since we do not support file upload on the workflow transition - I'm closing this issue as not a bug now. Please vote for the mentioned feature request issues as we prfioritize our feature backlog by the number of votes.

Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have further question regarding this issue.
 Thank you.

Cheers,
 Ignat
 JIRA Server Bugmaster.
{panel}
h4.

Attaching files in transition screen (on Filter Result gadget) failed with Internal Error message
h4. Steps to reproduce
 # Refer to any issues retrieved in Filter Result gadget (on the dashboard)
 # Click on the arrow > choose any transition
 # Try attaching any file

h4. Expected result

The attachment file should be uploaded successfully
h4. Actual Result

The attachment is not uploaded successfully and it throws error message "Internal Error"
 !attach.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Attaching files in transition screen (on Filter Result gadget) failed with Internal Error message

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42797].
  {panel}

*Problem Description*

Generating the backup from the latest release for JIRA Server (6.4.1) encounter the following error when importing to JIRA Cloud:

{quote}
The xml data you are trying to import is from JIRA 6.4.1, which is newer than your current version of JIRA and will not work. This data can be successfully imported into JIRA 6.3.12 or later., If JIRA 6.3.12 is not yet available for download, please contact support.
{quote}

*Expected Result*

Latest release of the JIRA Server should be supported to perform import to the JIRA Cloud instance. It is always recommended to use latest release to migrate or perform merging for the Cloud instances.

* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Migrating+from+JIRA+Cloud+to+JIRA+Server

*Workaround*

Use JIRA Server version 6.3.12 from the link below:

* https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/download-archives

Perform a restore using the backup XML and generate a new backup XML
fields.summary: Importing JIRA Server 6.4.1 to JIRA Cloud fails Due to JIRA Server having higher Version Number

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42794].
  {panel}

As a user of a federated JIRA installation I would like to have automatic JIRA issue linking in comments regardless of which instance the JIRA issue resides on so that I have full visibility of communications regarding issues in my JIRA site.

Currently in JIRA when I enter the Issue key for a JIRA issue into the comments of any issue JIRA will automatically create a hyperlink to the mentioned issue.  This also creates a backling from the issue to the comment.  In a federated installation JIRA will behave this way only for issues that are local to the JIRA instance.  For issues that are on a remote instance automatic hyperlinking does not work.

A rationale solution would be to add this as a native feature of the federated installation.  So that sites running configurations that are similar to the link below will have full access to the automatic linking featuer.

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ENTERPRISE/Federating+JIRA+-+Managing+Multiple+Instances
fields.summary: In comment linking of JIRA issues on remote instance

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42793].
  {panel}

Currently, when you access a dashboard other than the system dashboard and you don't have any favourites, this message displays:

'The dashboard that you are viewing will only be displayed temporarily, as you do not have it added as a favorite. To display this dashboard permanently, add it as a favorite.'

"add it as a favorite" currently adds the dashboard for you, but it doesn't educate the user on what they need to do, or how to do it. This should be changed to something more helpful like:

'This dashboard is not available in your Dashboard menu.
To add it to the Dashboard menu, you need to add it as a favorite on the Manage Dashboards page.'

"Manage Dashboards" should link to the Manage Dashboards page.
fields.summary: Change the message on your dashboards when you do not have any favorites to something more useful.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42792].
  {panel}

When you have dashboards created but you have not added them to your favourites, you are presented with the system default dashboard, and a warning message that states:

'You are viewing the 'System Default' dashboard, as you have not added any dashboards as favorites. To display your preferred dashboard here, click Manage Dashboard and add one or more dashboards as favorites.'

This could be worded better to provide more context and information. Suggest changing it to:

'You can access other dashboards, but they're not currently displayed in the Dashboards menu.
To display them in the Dashboards menu, add them as favorites in the Manage Dashboards page.'

"Manage Dashboards" should link to the Manage Dashboards page.
fields.summary: Change the information message on the System Dashboard page to something that makes more sense.

fields.description:

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42790].
  {panel}

After your JIRA session has timed out, the Projects menu no longer works, it just shows a little drop shadow. There's no indication that you need to log in again, or what's gone wrong.

h1. Steps to reproduce:

1. Login to JIRA.
2. Logout of JIRA in another tab: !screenshot-2.png!
3. On your first tab, click on “Projects”: !screenshot-1.png!
fields.summary: Projects menu does not open when session has timed out.
